module.name: LCLIntf
module.short: Contains WinAPI-like functions for Delphi compatibility.

descr.p: This unit was created for Delphi compatibility. It contains selected functions from the Delphi Windows unit, which finally are implemented in the widgetsets.

The functions can be used to make porting of Delphi applications easier, and are not 100% emulating WinAPI functions, not even under windows. They were implemented and tested with some common Delphi libraries. The LCL contains many extra functions that the Delphi VCL does not have.
descr.remark: Some functions are not exactly Delphi or WinAPI compatible.
descr.p: For example: Instead of using the common Windows functions SaveDC and RestoreDC use the Canvas.SaveHandleState and Canvas.RestoreHandleState.

element.name: Arc
element.short: Draws an elliptical curve.

descr.p: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen.

The angles Angle16Deg and Angle16DegLength are measure in 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360). Positive values of Angle16Deg and Angle16DegLength mean counter-clockwise rotation while negative values mean a clockwise direction, from the point of view of who looks at the screen.
Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position (right).

element.name: Arc.Angle16Deg
element.short: The starting angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: Arc.Angle16DegLength
element.short: The length of the arc. A positive value indicates that it goes counter-clockwise from the start angle and a negative value that it goes clockwise.

element.name: AngleChord
element.short: Draws a filled Chord described by two angles.

descr.p: AngleChord is a Lazarus addition, similar to the Windows API Chord, but uses angles to control the location of the chord inside the ellipse instead of two points like the Windows API Chord.

A Chord is a section of an ellipse between two angles (angle1 and angle2), closed by a straight line (secant). It's equivalent to a Pie without the triangle between the arc and the center of the ellipse.
The curve part of the chord is defined by the ellipse which fits in the bounding rectangle specified by the coordinates x1, y1, x2 and y2.
The Chord is outlined by the current Pen and filled with the current Brush.

element.name: AngleChord.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: AngleChord.angle1
element.short: The starting angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: AngleChord.angle2
element.short: The ending angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: BeginPaint
element.short: Start painting in a window.

descr.p: This function is for use in WM_PAINT handlers only. Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT messages.
BeginPaint prepares the specified window for painting and fills a PAINTSTRUCT structure with information about the painting.

element.name: BeginPaint.Result
element.short: A Device Context for the window, Nil on failure.

element.name: BeginPaint.Handle
element.short: The window Handle.

element.name: BeginPaint.PS
element.short: Will receive painting information.

element.name: BitBlt
element.short: Copies a section of a Canvas to another one, performing a raster operation (ROP).

descr.p: This routine implements the equivalent Windows GDI API of the same name in all platforms supported by Lazarus. It copies a section of a Canvas to another one, without any stretching. It allows one to select the kind of operation which should be performed to draw the pixels into the destination in the parameter ROP. Allowed operations go from simply copying the pixels without change to inverting them and also to executing logical operations involving the source pixels and the previously existing pixels in the destination Canvas.
For normal usage one should only use SRCOPY in the ROP parameter, other operations may not be supported by all widgetsets.
There exist 16 raster operations, according to the possible combinations of two (boolean) values. Excluding the NOP case, that doesn't modify the target area, the possible values for ROP are:

dl.dd: Fills the destination rectangle with black
Inverts the colors of the destination area
Fills the destination area with (Src and Pattern)
Fills the destination area with (Dst or not Src)
Fills the destination area with (not Src)
Fills the destination area with (not (Dst or Src))
Fills the destination area with (Pattern)
Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Pattern)
Fills the destination area with (Dst or (not Src) or Pattern)
Fills the destination area with (Dst and Src)
Fills the destination area with Src
Fills the destination area with ((not Dst) and Src)
Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Src)
Combines the colors of the source and the destination using the operator OR on each pixel
Fills the destination rectangle with white

descr.p: These flags can be added to above ROPs:

dl.dd: Includes windows which are on top of the specified Canvas. This option is not recommended and is very hard to implement in all supported platforms.
Prevents the bitmap from being mirrored. (The coordinates are sorted before painting?)

element.name: BitBlt.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: BitBlt.DestDC
element.short: The destination Device Context.

element.name: BitBlt.X
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Y
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Width
element.short: The image size.

element.name: BitBlt.Height
element.short: The image size.

element.name: BitBlt.SrcDC
element.short: The source Device Context.

element.name: BitBlt.XSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: BitBlt.YSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Rop
element.short: The raster operation.

element.name: CallNextHookEx
element.short: Calls the next procedure in the hook chain.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.Result
element.short: Depends on the Hook type.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.hhk
element.short: Handle of the current hook.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.ncode
element.short: The Hook code (message ID).

element.name: CallNextHookEx.WParam
element.short: Message parameter.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.LParam
element.short: Message parameter.

element.name: CallWindowProc
element.short: Calls another Window procedure, to handle a message.

element.name: ClientToScreen
element.short: Converts (relative) Client coordinates into absolute Screen coordinates.

element.name: ClientToScreen.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: ClientToScreen.Handle
element.short: The window handle with the client area.

element.name: ClientToScreen.P
element.short: The point to convert.

element.name: CombineRgn
element.short: Combines two regions.

descr.p: The following parameters are present in this function:

dl.dd: The Handle of a region which will receive the result of the operation
One of the two regions to combine
The other region to combine
The method to use to combine the regions. As for the parameter fnCombineMode, the following constants from the unit LCLType can be used:
The result is the intersection of the two combined regions.
The result is a copy of the region Src1
Combines the parts of Src1 that are not part of Src2.
The result is the union of the two regions.
The result is the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

element.name: CombineRgn.Dest
element.short: The Handle of the destination region. This region must already exist!

element.name: CombineRgn.Src1
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: CombineRgn.Src2
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: CombineRgn.fnCombineMode
element.short: How the regions are combined.

element.name: CreateBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap object.

element.name: CreateBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateBitmap.Planes
element.short: The number of color planes.

element.name: CreateBitmap.BitCount
element.short: The number of color bits per pixel and plane.

element.name: CreateBitmap.BitmapBits
element.short: The bitmap pixels. Scanlines must be word-aligned.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect
element.short: Creates a brush object (bitmap).
element.descr: A brush is used to fill image areas (background...). It has a color and a pattern, e.g. BS_SOLID.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect.Result
element.short: The brush Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect.LogBrush
element.short: Description of the brush.

element.name: CreateCaret
element.short: Creates a Caret (text cursor).
element.descr: This description is taken from the WinAPI, no guarantee for other platforms.

element.name: CreateCaret.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: CreateCaret.Handle
element.short: The window that owns the caret.

element.name: CreateCaret.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap Handle, or zero for a solid (black) caret, 1 for a grey caret.

element.name: CreateCaret.width
element.short: The width of the caret, in logical units.

element.name: CreateCaret.Height
element.short: The height of the caret, in logical units.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap that is compatible with the given DC.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.DC
element.short: The Device Context for the bitmap.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Width
element.short: The bitmap width in pixels.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Height
element.short: The bitmap height in pixels.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC
element.short: Creates an memory Device Context, compatible with the device of the given DC.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC.Result
element.short: The memory DC, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC.DC
element.short: The device DC.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap
element.short: Creates a Device Dependent Bitmap (DDB) from a Device Independent Bitmap (DIB).

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.DC
element.short: The context for the DDB.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InfoHeader
element.short: The bitmap info header.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InitBits
element.short: An array containing the bitmap pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InitInfo
element.short: CBM_INIT when InitBits contains valid data, else zero.

element.name: CreateDIBSection
element.short: Creates a bitmap into which the application can write.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.DC
element.short: The DC for the bitmap.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.BitmapInfo
element.short: Contains all information about the bitmap, except the pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Usage
element.short: The type of the bitmap colors, e.g. DIB_RGB_COLORS.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Bits
element.short: Pointer to the bitmap pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.SectionHandle
element.short: Zero or the Handle of a file-mapping object, from which the bitmap is initialized (needs CreateFileMapping).

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Offset
element.short: The offset to the bitmap bits in the file-mapping object.

element.name: CreateEllipticRgn
element.short: Creates an elliptic region.

element.name: CreateEllipticRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect
element.short: Creates a logical font, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect.LogFont
element.short: The font description.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx
element.short: Creates a logical font, selectable into any DC. Allows for a long font name.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.LogFont
element.short: The font description.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.LongFontName
element.short: The font name, can be longer than 32 characters.

element.name: CreateIconIndirect
element.short: Creates an icon or cursor.

element.name: CreateIconIndirect.Result
element.short: The Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePalette
element.short: Creates a logical palette, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreatePalette.Result
element.short: The palette Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush
element.short: Creates a logical brush, selectable into any DC.

descr.p: The bitmap pattern is repeated for areas of larger width or height, it should allow for smooth transitions.
Monochrome bitmaps obtain the actual text (0) or background (1) color of the DC.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush.Result
element.short: The brush handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush.ABitmap
element.short: The bitmap to use for the brush.

element.name: CreatePenIndirect
element.short: Creates a logical Pen, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreatePenIndirect.Result
element.short: The pen Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn
element.short: Creates a polygonal region.
element.descr: The last point is connected to the first point, to close the region.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.Points
element.short: The array of points.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.FillMode
element.short: Can be ALTERNATE or WINDING.

element.name: CreateRectRgn
element.short: Creates a rectangular region.

element.name: CreateRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn
element.short: Creates a rectangular region with rounded corners.

descr.p: Creates a rectangular region with rounded corners. All parameters in logical units.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.nWidthEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.nHeightEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: DeleteCriticalSection
element.short: Deletes an unowned critical section.
element.errors: Results are unpredictable when the section is owned, i.e. has been entered but not yet left.

element.name: DeleteDC
element.short: Deletes a Device Context, created by CreateDC.

element.name: DeleteDC.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DeleteObject
element.short: Frees a GDI object.
element.descr: The bitmap of a pattern brush is not destroyed with the brush.
element.errors: The function fails when the Handle is selected into an DC.

element.name: DeleteObject.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCaret
element.short: Destroys the caret but doesn't free the bitmap.

element.name: DestroyCaret.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCaret.Handle
element.short: Handle of the window with the caret.

element.name: DestroyCursor
element.short: Destroys an mouse cursor.

element.name: DestroyCursor.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCursor.Handle
element.short: The cursor Handle.

element.name: DestroyIcon
element.short: Destroys an icon.

element.name: DestroyIcon.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DPtoLP
element.short: Converts an array of Device Points (coordinates) into Logical Points.

element.name: DPtoLP.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DPtoLP.DC
element.short: The device context, containing the coordinate mapping information.

element.name: DPtoLP.Points
element.short: An array of points.

element.name: DPtoLP.Count
element.short: The number of points to convert.

element.name: DrawFrameControl
element.short: Draws a window frame for a control of the specified type and style.

element.name: DrawFrameControl.Result
element.short: Returns False when the control type is anything other than a button.

element.name: DrawFrameControl.DC
element.short: Device context where the operation is performed.

element.name: DrawFrameControl.Rect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds for the control.

element.name: DrawFrameControl.uType
element.short: Identifies the type of control for the frame.

element.name: DrawFrameControl.uState
element.short: Identifies the state for the control.

element.name: DrawFocusRect
element.short: Determines if the focus rectangle is handled by the widgetset class.

element.name: DrawFocusRect.DC
element.short: Device content for the operation.

element.name: DrawEdge
element.short: Draws one or more edges for a rectangle.

element.name: DrawText
element.short: Draws formatted text on the specified device context.

element.name: DrawText.Result
element.short: 1 on success, 0 when text could not be drawn.

element.name: DrawText.DC
element.short: Device context used to measure and render the specified Text.

element.name: DrawText.Str
element.short: Text drawn in the routine.

element.name: DrawText.Count
element.short: Length of the value in Str; calculated when Count is negative.

element.name: DrawText.Rect
element.short: Rectangle where the text was drawn.

element.name: DrawText.Flags
element.short: DrawText flags examined in the routine.

element.name: EnableScrollBar
element.short: Enables or disables the arrows of a scroll bar control, or of the scroll bars of a window.

element.name: EnableWindow
element.short: Enables or disables mouse and keyboard input to the specified window or control.

element.name: EndPaint
element.short: Ends painting a window, started with BeginPaint.

element.name: EnterCriticalSection
element.short: Enters a critical section.

element.name: EnumDisplayMonitors
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every available display monitor.

element.name: EnumFontFamilies
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every font available on a specified device.

element.name: EnumFontFamiliesEx
element.short: Invokes a callback function for every available font that matches certain criteria.

element.name: Ellipse
element.short: Draws a filled circle or ellipse, bounded by a rectangle.

element.name: ExcludeClipRect
element.short: Excludes a rectangle from the clipping region, i.e. allows one to paint within the rectangle.

element.name: ExtCreatePen
element.short: Creates a logical pen, selectable into any DC.

element.name: ExtTextOut
element.short: Draws an string without formatting (single line).

element.name: ExtSelectClipRGN
element.short: Combines the passed Region with the current clipping region.

element.name: FillRect
element.short: Fills a rectangle by using the specified brush.

element.name: FillRgn
element.short: Fills a region using the specified brush.

element.name: FloodFill
element.short: Fills an area of the display surface with the current brush.

element.name: FrameRect
element.short: Draws a border around a rectangle.

element.name: GetActiveWindow
element.short: Returns the Handle of the active window of the calling thread.

element.name: GetBitmapBits
element.short: Fills an buffer with the bitmap bits.

element.name: GetBkColor
element.short: Returns the background color of an device context.

element.name: GetCapture
element.short: Returns the window that captures mouse messages.

element.name: GetCaretPos
element.short: Returns the caret position, in client coordinates.

element.name: GetClientRect
element.short: Returns the client rectangle of a control. Left and Top are always 0.

descr.p: The client rectangle is the size of the inner area of a control, where the child controls are visible.
A child control with Align=alClient will completely fill the clientrect.

element.name: GetClipBox
element.short: Returns the smallest rectangle which includes the entire clipping region of an device context.

element.name: GetClipRGN
element.short: Returns the clipping region of an device context.

element.name: GetCurrentObject
element.short: Returns an currently selected object in an device context.

element.name: GetCharABCWidths
element.short: Returns the ABC widths of an range of character codes.

element.name: GetDC
element.short: Returns the handle of an Device Context (DC) for the client area of a window.

element.name: GetDeviceCaps
element.short: Returns various device specific information.

descr.p: Returns information about any DC (Device Context), which might be the screen DC representing the monitor, a control canvas or a offscreen bitmap canvas. The following constants can be utilized in the index argument:

ul.li: LOGPIXELSX - the DPI in the X axis
LOGPIXELSY - the DPI in the Y axis

descr.p: An example showing how to obtain the screen DPI for the X axis using GetDeviceCaps, which is the method utilized by TScreen.PixelsPerInch:

element.name: GetDoubleClickTime
element.short: Returns the double-click time, in milliseconds.

element.name: GetDIBits
element.short: Fill an buffer with the bitmap bits.

element.name: GetDIBits.Bitmap
element.short: The (device dependent) bitmap handle.

element.name: GetDIBits.Bits
element.short: Pointer to the output buffer, or Nil to get the required dimensions.

element.name: GetFocus
element.short: Returns the handle of the window that has the focus in the current thread.

element.name: GetFontLanguageInfo
element.short: Returns language information about the currently selected font.

element.name: GetForegroundWindow
element.short: Returns the window that the user is currently working with, session wide.

element.name: GetIconInfo
element.short: Returns information about an Icon or Cursor.

element.name: GetKeyState
element.short: The status of a virtual key.

element.name: GetMapMode
element.short: Returns the mapping mode of an device context.

element.name: GetMonitorInfo
element.short: Returns information about an display monitor.

element.name: GetObject
element.short: Returns information about a graphics object.

element.name: GetPaletteEntries
element.short: Retrieves an range of color entries from a logical palette.

element.name: GetParent
element.short: Returns the parent window of a window.

element.name: GetProp
element.short: Retrieves an property value for a window.

element.name: GetRgnBox
element.short: Returns the bounding rectangle of a region, containing the entire region.

element.name: GetROP2
element.short: The current Foreground Mixing Mode in an device context.

element.name: GetScrollInfo
element.short: Returns all or selected information about a Scroll Bar.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.Handle
element.short: The Scroll Bar or window handle.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.SBStyle
element.short: The Scroll Bar kind.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.ScrollInfo
element.short: Receives the values indicated in fMask.

element.name: GetStockObject
element.short: Retrieves a handle to one of the predefined graphic objects.

element.name: GetSysColor
element.short: Retrieves the system color for standard display elements.

element.name: GetSysColorBrush
element.short: Retrieves a system brush for standard display elements.

element.name: GetSystemPaletteEntries
element.short: Retrieves an range of color entries from the system palette for a device.

element.name: GetSystemMetrics
element.short: Retrieves various system metrics.

element.name: GetTextColor
element.short: The current text color in an device context.

element.name: GetTextExtentExPoint
element.short: Calculates the number of characters, that fit into some horizontal space.

element.name: GetTextExtentPoint
element.short: Computes the display width and height of an string.

element.name: GetTextExtentPoint32
element.short: Computes the display width and height of an string.

element.name: GetTextMetrics
element.short: Retrieves the metrics for the currently selected font.

element.name: GetViewPortExtEx
element.short: Returns the size of the viewport of an device context.

element.name: GetViewPortOrgEx
element.short: Returns the origin of the viewport of an device context.

element.name: GetWindowExtEx
element.short: Returns the extent of a window, in logical units.

element.name: GetWindowLong
element.short: Returns attributes of a window.

element.name: GetWindowRect
element.short: Retrieves the bounding rectangle of a window, including the window decoration in screen coordinates.
element.descr:
Retrieves the bounding rectangle of a window, including the window decoration. The coordinates are given relative to the upper-left corner of the screen in screen.
After the call, Rect will be the control area in screen coordinates. That means, Left and Top will be the screen coordinate of the TopLeft pixel of the Handle object and Right and Bottom will be the screen coordinate of the BottomRight pixel.

element.name: GetWindowSize
element.short: Returns the Width and Height of a window, including the window decoration.

descr.p: This function is a Lazarus addition and does not exist in the Windows API. It returns the Width and Height of a window, including the window decoration. To get the size of a form without the window decoration just use TCustomForm.Width and TCustomForm.Height or TCustomForm.ClientWidth and TCustomForm.ClientHeight.

element.name: GetWindowOrgEx
element.short: Retrieves the window origin of an device context, in logical units.

element.name: GradientFill
element.short: Fills rectangle or triangle areas with gradient colors.

element.name: HideCaret
element.short: Removes the caret from the screen.

element.name: IntersectClipRect
element.short: Shrinks the clipping region of an Device Context to a rectangular boundary, e.g. a text area.
element.descr: The result can be one of the following constants: Error, NullRegion, SimpleRegion, ComplexRegion, or Region_Error

element.name: IntersectClipRect.Result
element.short: The region type, zero on failure.

element.name: InvalidateRect
element.short: Marks a display area for repaint.

element.name: InvalidateRgn
element.short: Marks a display area for repaint.

element.name: IsIconic
element.short: True when the window is minimized.

element.name: IsWindow
element.short: Checks whether a handle refers to a window.

element.name: IsWindowEnabled
element.short: Determines whether a window can receive mouse and keyboard input.

element.name: IsWindowVisible
element.short: The definite Visible state of a window.

element.name: IsZoomed
element.short: True when the window is maximized.

element.name: InitializeCriticalSection
element.short: Initializes a Critical Section object.

element.name: LeaveCriticalSection
element.short: Releases a critical section, for use by other threads.

element.name: LineTo
element.short: Draws a line from the current position up to, but not including, the specified point.

element.name: LPtoDP
element.short: Converts logical coordinates into device coordinates.

element.name: MaskBlt
element.short: Copies part of an source DC into an destination DC, using the specified foreground and background raster operations.

descr.p: MaskBlt behaves like BitBlt when no mask bitmap is specified. It does a SRCOPY operation when also no ROP is specified. See BitBlt for general information about raster operations.

Rop contains both a foreground and a background raster operation (see MakeROP4). When a (monochrome) mask bitmap is present, its bits select either the foreground (1) or background (0) raster operation.

element.name: MessageBox
element.short: The MessageBox function displays an modal dialog, with the given text, caption, icon and buttons.

element.name: MonitorFromPoint
element.short: Finds an monitor from screen coordinates.

element.name: MonitorFromWindow
element.short: Finds the monitor covering most of a window.

element.name: MoveToEx
element.short: Moves the current position to the specified point.

element.name: OffsetRgn
element.short: Moves a region relative.

element.name: Pie
element.short: Draws a filled pie-shaped wedge, from an ellipse and two radials.

element.name: PolyBezier
element.short: Draws Bzier curves.
element.descr: Use Polybezier to draw cubic Bzier curves. The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point with the second and third points being the control points. If the Continuous flag is TRUE then each subsequent curve requires three more points, using the end-point of the previous Curve as its starting point, the first and second points being used as its control points, and the third point its end-point. If the continuous flag is set to FALSE, then each subsequent Curve requires 4 additional points, which are used exactly as in the first curve. Any additional points which do not add up to a full Bzier(4 for Continuous, 3 otherwise) are ignored. There must be at least 4 points for an drawing to occur. If the Filled Flag is set to TRUE then the resulting Poly-Bzier will be drawn as a Polygon.

element.name: Polygon
element.short: Draws a Polygon.
element.descr: Use Polygon to draw a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, using the value of Pen. After drawing the complete shape, Polygon fills the shape using the value of Brush. The Points parameter is an array of points that give the vertices of the polygon. Winding determines how the polygon is filled. When Winding is True, Polygon fills the shape using the Winding fill algorithm. When Winding is False, Polygon uses the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm. StartIndex gives the index of the first point in the array to use. All points before this are ignored. NumPts indicates the number of points to use, starting at StartIndex. If NumPts is -1 (the default), Polygon uses all points from StartIndex to the end of the array. The first point is always connected to the last point. To draw a polygon on the canvas, without filling it, use the Polyline method, specifying the first point a second time at the end.

element.name: Polyline
element.short: Draws a sequence of lines.
element.descr: Use Polyline to connect a set of points on the canvas. If you specify only two points, Polyline draws a single line. The Points parameter is an array of points to be connected. StartIndex identifies the first point in the array to use. NumPts indicates the number of points to use. If NumPts is -1 (the default), PolyLine uses all the points from StartIndex to the end of the array. Calling the MoveTo function with the value of the first point, and then repeatedly calling LineTo with all subsequent points will draw the same image on the canvas. However, unlike LineTo, Polyline does not change the value of PenPos.

element.name: PostMessage
element.short: Sends a message to a window.

descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages. These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the Handle parameter of this routine. Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER. The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: RedrawWindow
element.short: Redraws (part of) a window.

element.name: ReleaseCapture
element.short: Restores normal mouse input processing, after .

element.name: ReleaseDC
element.short: Releases an Device Context obtained by GetDC.

element.name: ReleaseDC.Result
element.short: Zero on failure.

element.name: ReleaseDC.hWnd
element.short: The window associated with the DC.

element.name: RemoveProp
element.short: Removes a named property from a window.

element.name: RestoreDC
element.short: Restores an Device Context (DC) to an previously saved state.

element.name: SaveDC
element.short: Saves the state of an Device Context in the context stack.

element.name: ScreenToClient
element.short: Converts absolute Screen coordinates into Client relative coordinates.

element.name: ScreenToClient.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: ScreenToClient.Handle
element.short: The window with the client area.

element.name: ScreenToClient.P
element.short: The point to convert.

element.name: SendMessage
element.short: Sends a message directed to a window to the message pool of the application.

descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages. These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the HandleWnd parameter of this routine. Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER. The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: SendMessage.HandleWnd
element.short: The handle of the window to receive the message.

element.name: SetActiveWindow
element.short: Sets focus to the specified window, if the application is on top.

element.name: SetBkColor
element.short: Sets the current background color of an device context.

element.name: SetBkMode
element.short: Sets the background mix mode (transparency) of an device context.

element.name: SetCapture
element.short: Sets the mouse capture to the specified window.

element.name: SetCaretPos
element.short: Moves the Caret to the specified coordinates.

element.name: SetCaretPosEx
element.short: Moves the Caret into a window.

element.name: SetCursor
element.short: Changes the shape of the mouse cursor.

element.name: SetCursorPos
element.short: Changes the position of the mouse cursor.

element.name: SetMapMode
element.short: Sets the mapping mode of an device context.

element.name: SetMenu
element.short: Assigns a menu to a window.

element.name: SetParent
element.short: Changes the parent of a window.

element.name: SetProp
element.short: Adds a property to a window.

element.name: SetROP2
element.short: Sets the Foreground Mixing Mode in an device context.

element.name: SelectClipRGN
element.short: Sets the ClipRegion of an DeviceContext.

element.name: SelectObject
element.short: Selects an object into an device context.

element.name: SetFocus
element.short: Sets the keyboard input focus to the specified window.

element.name: SetForegroundWindow
element.short: Moves a window in front of all other windows, and activates it.

element.name: SetStretchBltMode
element.short: Sets the StrechBlt mode for an device context.

element.name: SetSysColors
element.short: Sets the colors for one or more display elements of window borders and desktop.

element.name: SetTextCharacterExtra
element.short: Sets extra inter-character spacing in text output.

element.name: SetTextColor
element.short: Sets the text color in an device context.

element.name: SetViewPortExtEx
element.short: Sets the extent of the viewport for a device context.

element.name: SetViewPortOrgEx
element.short: Sets the device origin corresponding to the window origin (0,0) in an device context.

element.name: SetWindowExtEx
element.short: Sets the extent of the window for an device context.

element.name: SetWindowLong
element.short: Sets an attribute of a window.

element.name: SetWindowOrgEx
element.short: Specifies which window point maps to the viewport origin (0,0).

element.name: SetWindowPos
element.short: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a window.

element.name: SetWindowRgn
element.short: Defines the visible region of a window or control.

descr.p: This function sets the visible region of a window or control. It's parameters are:

dl.dd: The handle of the window or control
The handle to the region which contains the visible section of the window or control
True if the control or window should be repainted following the call of this function, false otherwise. See also the wiki documentation: Creating a Non-Rectangular Window or Control

element.name: ShowCaret
element.short: Shows the Caret (text cursor).

element.name: ShowScrollBar
element.short: Shows or hides a Scroll Bar.

element.name: ShowWindow
element.short: Shows a window in an specific state.

element.name: StretchBlt
element.short: Copies a rectangular region into an device context, shrinking or stretching it as required.

element.name: StretchDIBits
element.short: Copies a rectangular region from a DIB into an device context, shrinking or stretching it as required.

element.name: SystemParametersInfo
element.short: Retrieves or sets one of the system-wide parameters.

element.name: TextOut
element.short: Draws an string without formatting (single line).

element.name: UpdateWindow
element.short: Forces an immediate repaint of a window, if required.

element.name: WindowFromPoint
element.short: Finds the window containing the specified point.

element.name: EqualRect
element.short: Returns True when the rectangles are identical.

element.name: GetScrollPos
element.short: Returns the scroll bar position.
element.descr: If the scroll bar is not visible, then the return value is 0.

element.name: GetScrollPos.Result
element.short: The position, zero if the scroll bar is not visible.

element.name: GetScrollRange
element.short: Returns the minimum and maximum Position values of a Scroll Bar.

element.name: GetRValue
element.short: Extracts the red color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetGValue
element.short: Extracts the green color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetBValue
element.short: Extracts the blue color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetRGBValues
element.short: Extracts the red, green and blue color values from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetRGBIntValues
element.short: Extracts the red, green and blue color values from a COLORREF.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask
element.short: Converts an imagelist index into an overlay index.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask.Result
element.short: Ready for combination with another imagelist index.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask.iOverlay
element.short: The imagelist index of the overlay.

element.name: InflateRect
element.short: Inflates the rectangle in all directions.

descr.p: The deltas are applied to every side, i.e. the width and height increase by the double amount.
Positive values inflate, negative values deflate.
The rectangle is clipped so that width and height never can become negative.
This method can be used to add or subtract a border around the rectangle.

element.name: InflateRect.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: InflateRect.ARect
element.short: This rectangle is modified.

element.name: InflateRect.dx
element.short: The horizontal increase, negative to decrease.

element.name: InflateRect.dy
element.short: The vertical increase, negative to decrease.

element.name: IntersectRect
element.short: Intersects SrcRect1 and SrcRect2 into DestRect.

descr.p: Intersecting means that DestRect will be the overlapping area of SrcRect1 and SrcRect2.
If SrcRect1 and SrcRect2 do not overlap the Result is false, else true.

element.name: IntersectRect.Result
element.short: False when the rectangles don't overlap.

element.name: IntersectRect.DestRect
element.short: Receives the intersection.

element.name: IsCharAlphaNumeric
element.short: Checks for ASCII letter or digit characters.

element.name: IsCharAlphaNumeric.Result
element.short: True when the character is a letter or digit.

element.name: IsRectEmpty
element.short: Returns True if the rectangle is empty.
element.descr: IsEmptyRect returns true if the area of the rectangle is empty, i.e. has a zero or negative width or height.

element.name: IsRectEmpty.Result
element.short: True if the rectangle is empty.

element.name: KillTimer
element.short: Removes an timer.

element.name: KillTimer.Result
element.short: Zero on failure!

element.name: KillTimer.Wnd
element.short: The window handle associated with the timer, can be zero.

element.name: KillTimer.uIDEvent
element.short: The timer ID.

element.name: MakeLong
element.short: Copies two words into a double word.

element.name: MakeLong.Result
element.short: The combined doubleword.

element.name: MakeLong.A
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLong.B
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeWord
element.short: Copies two bytes into a word.

element.name: MakeWord.A
element.short: The low byte.

element.name: MakeWord.B
element.short: The high byte.

element.name: MakeWParam
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message wParam.
element.descr: The result has the size of an pointer.

element.name: MakeWParam.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeWParam.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeLParam
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message lParam.

element.name: MakeLParam.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLParam.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeLResult
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message Result.

element.name: MakeLResult.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLResult.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: OffSetRect
element.short: Move Left/Right by dx, Top/Bottom by dy. Return Top and Left are >= 0.

element.name: OffSetRect.Result
element.short: False if resulting Top or Left are negative.

element.name: PtInRect
element.short: Checks whether a Point is within a Rect.

descr.p: Top and Left side are part of the rectangle, but Bottom and Right side are outside.

element.name: PtInRect.Result
element.short: True when Point is within Rect.

element.name: RGB
element.short: Combines Red, Green and Blue values into an TColorRef value.

descr.p: The bytes are shifted into place, following the format $00bbggrr, which is the format of the Windows API type COLORREF. Their actual physical order depends on the endianness of the machine.

element.name: RGB.Result
element.short: The combined COLORREF created with the given color channels.

element.name: RGB.R
element.short: The value of the red channel. zero indicates no contribution, 255 indicates a full red channel.

element.name: RGB.G
element.short: The value of the green channel.

element.name: RGB.B
element.short: The value of the blue channel.

element.name: ScrollWindow
element.short: Scrolls the content of a window, by a number of pixels.

element.name: ScrollWindow.XAmount
element.short: Horizontal distance (positive to scroll right).

element.name: ScrollWindow.YAmount
element.short: Vertical distance (positive to scroll down).

element.name: ScrollWindow.Rect
element.short: The part of the window, that is to be scrolled.

element.name: ScrollWindow.ClipRect
element.short: Pixels falling outside this rectangle are lost.

element.name: SetRect
element.short: Copies coordinates into a rectangle.

element.name: SetRect.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetRectEmpty
element.short: Clears the rectangle to all zero coordinates.

element.name: SetRectEmpty.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetScrollPos
element.short: Changes the Position of an Scroll Bar slider.
element.descr: The SetScrollPos function sets the position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar and, if requested, redraws the scroll bar to reflect the new position of the scroll box.

element.name: SetScrollPos.Result
element.short: The previous Position, zero if invisible.

element.name: SetScrollPos.Handle
element.short: The Scroll Bar or Window Handle.

element.name: SetScrollPos.nBar
element.short: SB_CTL means a Scroll Bar control.

element.name: SetScrollPos.nPos
element.short: The new Position.

element.name: SetScrollPos.bRedraw
element.short: True forces a repaint.

element.name: SetScrollRange
element.short: Sets the minimum and maximum position values of an Scroll Bar.

element.name: SetScrollRange.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetTimer
element.short: Creates or resets an timer for the given time interval.

descr.p: Every timer has a unique ID, which is reported in the timer message and can be used to reset or kill the timer.
When the time has elapsed, the callback procedure is invoked. If no procedure is given, a WM_TIMER message is sent to the window. If also no window is given, the function fails.
When the timer already exists, it is reset to the new interval.

element.name: SetTimer.Result
element.short: The timer ID, or zero on failure.

element.name: SetTimer.Wnd
element.short: The window associated with the timer.

element.name: SetTimer.nIDEvent
element.short: The ID of the timer, ignored when Wnd is zero.

element.name: SetTimer.uElapse
element.short: The time interval to wait.

element.name: SetTimer.lpTimerFunc
element.short: The callback procedure, can be Nil.

element.name: SmallPointToPoint
element.short: Converts an TSmallPoint into an TPoint.

element.name: SubtractRect
element.short: Computes the bounding box of the geometric difference of two rectangles.

descr.p: When the rectangles do not overlap completely in either x or y direction, the result is the first rectangle (lprcSrc1).
Otherwise the overlapping area is excluded from the first rectangle.
The bounding box is the rectangle that covers the entire resulting area.

element.name: SubtractRect.Result
element.short: False when the resulting rectangle is empty.

element.name: SubtractRect.lprcSrc2
element.short: The rectangle to subtract.

element.name: UnionRect
element.short: Computes the bounding box of the union of two rectangles.

descr.p: The bounding box is the rectangle that covers the entire resulting area. Here the result covers both rectangles.
The rectangles can be disjoint.
Rectangles with a zero or negative width or height are treated as empty rectangles (ignored).

element.name: UnionRect.Result
element.short: False when the resulting rectangle is empty, i.e. when both source rectangles are empty.

element.name: GetTickCount
element.short: Number of ticks (milliseconds) elapsed since the computer was started.

descr.p: GetTickCount is a DWord function used to get the number of ticks (milliseconds) elapsed since the computer was started. GetTickCount calls the GetTickCount64 function in LazSysUtils to get the return value.

element.name: GetTickCount.Result
element.short: Elapsed ticks (milliseconds).

element.name: GetTickCount64
element.short: Number of ticks (milliseconds) elapsed since the computer was started.

descr.p: GetTickCount64 is a QWord function used to get the number of ticks (milliseconds) elapsed since the computer was started. GetTickCount64 calls the GetTickCount64 function in LazSysUtils to get the return value.

element.name: GetTickCount64.Result
element.short: Elapsed ticks (milliseconds).

element.name: FindDefaultBrowser
element.short: Gets the path to the default browser and its parameters.

element.name: FindDefaultBrowser.Result
element.short: True the default browser was found for the platform.

element.name: FindDefaultBrowser.ABrowser
element.short: Qualified path to the executable for the default browser.

element.name: FindDefaultBrowser.AParams
element.short: Parameters needed to start the default browser for the platform.

element.name: OpenURL
element.short: Open a given URL with the default browser.

descr.p: The function uses FindDefaultBrowser to find the default browser for the platform. If it was found, it is started and the returns value is set to True.

AURL is passed as parameter to the browser application. AURL must be an URL like http://www.lazarus.freepascal.org or file:///tmp/test.txt or file://C:\test.txt. AURL is quoted when passed as an argument to ensure that space(s) in the path or file name are handled properly.

element.name: OpenURL.Result
element.short: True if the browser was found and called to open the URL.

element.name: OpenURL.AURL
element.short: URL with the resource to open in the browser.

element.name: OpenDocument
element.short: Opens the specified document using the default application for the platform or widgetset.

descr.p: OpenDocument is a Boolean function used to open the document specified in APath using the default application for the platform or widget set.

The implementation of OpenDocument is platform- and/or WidgetSet-specific. On Windows, the OpenURL function is called to open the specified document. For UNIX-like platforms, the OpenDocumentWidgetsetImplementation is called when assigned. Otherwise, FindFIlenameOfCmd is used to check for common Desktop Environment applications for the platform. RunCmdFromPath is called to open the document using the requisite application.

The return value contains True if an application is available to for the specified file name. The return value is False if an application cannot be found for the specified file, or the file does not exist in the given path.

element.name: OpenDocument.Result
element.short: True if an application was found and the document was opened.

element.name: OpenDocument.APath
element.short: Full path and file name to open in the routine.
